js.user
Class JsCanvasGradient

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Var<JsObject>
          js.core.JsObject
              js.dom.DOM.CanvasGradient.Prototype
                  js.user.JsCanvasGradient
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectLike
public class JsCanvasGradient
extends DOM.CanvasGradient.Prototype

An opaque class representing JavaScript client-side objects of the global JsClient.CanvasGradient class.

An object of this opaque class represents a color gradient that may be assigned to both the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle and JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle properties of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle object. The JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number) and JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number) methods both return objects of this class.

Once you have created an object of this class, use addColorStop(Number, String) method to specify what colors should appear at what positions within the gradient. Between the positions you specify, colors are interpolated to create a smooth gradient or fade. Transparent black stops are created implicitly at the start and end points of the gradient.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects. The checkcast operation to the class literal of this interface must be ignored and instanceof to it always true.

addColorStop

public final void addColorStop(java.lang.Number offset,
                               java.lang.String color)

Specifies a color and position for the gradient.

This method provides the mechanism for describing color changes in a gradient. It may be called one or more times to change the color at particular percentages between the gradient's start and end points.

If this method is never called on a gradient, the gradient is transparent. At least one color stop must be specified to produce a visible color gradient.

Parameters:
offset - A floating-point value in the range 0.0 to 1.0 that represents a fraction between the start and end points of the gradient. An offset of 0 corresponds to the start point, and an offset of 1 corresponds to the end point.
color - Specifies the color to be displayed at the specified offset, as a CSS color string. Colors at other points along the gradient are interpolated based on this and any other color stops.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.
